pull.title: [doc] conf: Remove deprecated options from docs, Other cleanup
pull.body:
Some dumb fixes, like removing the mention that free transactions are still a thing or that rpcuser/pass should be used (as opposed to rpcauth or rpc cookie).

Combined with other fixes because I don't want to create 3 pull requests:
* conf: Remove deprecated options from docs
* Remove only mention of MIT/X11
* Link to developer notes in README.md

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -80,9 +80,9 @@ Running
 
 Bitcoin Core is now available at `./src/bitcoind`
 
-Before running, it's recommended that you create an RPC configuration file:
+Before running, you may create an RPC configuration file:
comments.body: No longer a RPC configuration file if empty? :-)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -80,9 +80,9 @@ Running
 
 Bitcoin Core is now available at `./src/bitcoind`
 
-Before running, it's recommended that you create an RPC configuration file:
+Before running, you may create an RPC configuration file:
 
-    echo -e "rpcuser=bitcoinrpc\nrpcpassword=$(xxd -l 16 -p /dev/urandom)" > "/Users/${USER}/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/bitcoin.conf"
+    echo > "/Users/${USER}/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/bitcoin.conf"
comments.body: Use `touch "/Users/${USER}/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/bitcoin.conf"` to create an empty file

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,12 +71,9 @@
 # is .cookie and found in the `-datadir` being used for bitcoind. This option is typically used
 # when the server and client are run as the same user.
 #
-# If not, you must set rpcuser and rpcpassword to secure the JSON-RPC api. The first
-# method(DEPRECATED) is to set this pair for the server and client:
-#rpcuser=Ulysseys
-#rpcpassword=YourSuperGreatPasswordNumber_DO_NOT_USE_THIS_OR_YOU_WILL_GET_ROBBED_385593
+# If not, you must set rpcuser and rpcpassword to secure the JSON-RPC api.

@@ -80,9 +80,9 @@ Running
 
 Bitcoin Core is now available at `./src/bitcoind`
 
-Before running, it's recommended that you create an RPC configuration file:
+Before running, you may create an empty RPC configuration file:
comments.body: Do we generally refer to `bitcoin.conf` as "configuration file" or "RPC configuration file"?
